page.title: 08A MOTORISTS' SERVICE AREA?
page.content: Takeley has always been a stopping place - its name may have come from the Saxon 'Teg-ley' or 'sheep clearing' - a place where sheep could be rested for the night. Today it caters more for the motorist with four service garages, a restaurant designed for the travelling motorist, a motel for overnight accommodation and the public houses all provide snack meals. Even the Post Office sells hot pies to take away. It is also interesting to note that there are two crash repair specialists and a large car breakers yard. The largest commercial enterprise is motorist orientated as it supplies and services caravans. Nearly every household in Takeley owns a motor car and very many have more than one.
